Reviews.Title: “Best hotel expereince I've had in a long time!”
Reviews.Author: JL A
Reviews.Content: The staff displayed great customer service. The hotel is beautiful. The waterfront location added to the overall experieince. I can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “FIVE STAR and MORE!!!”
Reviews.Author: 1DallasCowboyfan
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Four Seasons this weekend for a business meeting. The service was spectacular. From the moment I checked in, I was greeted with a smile by EVERY employee and staff member. I was in a PREMIER Harborview room which was spacious anc very comfortable. One of my colleagues had a mid level suite. The decor was amazing. I hated to leave earlier today!!

Reviews.Title: “Great service, great experience, great building”
Reviews.Author: BobKop
Reviews.Content: The Four Seasons Baltimore is a great, new, top notch hotel in the centrally located Harbor East area. It is close (7 minute walk) to the Inner Harbor (National Aquarium/Phillips Seafood etc) and close (7 minute walk) to Fells Point. The hotel has some of the best views, depending on whether your room is south or west facing. Their social function rooms are great, we had an event and it was great. Very nice staff, great food and top shelf drinks. I definitely recommend it. TIP: Their bar has a GREAT happy hour that includes $1.88 Nattie Boh's (beer)

Reviews.Title: “Great new property, trying very hard”
Reviews.Author: Ramatash
Reviews.Content: I found myself at the hotel because my flights were cancelled and what a wonderful place to be stranded! The service was territic - Trey at the front desk was especially helpful. We had issues getting to our flight the next day and the concierge was incredibly helpful. The breakfast was wonderful, but the value wasn't really there. I know it only opened a few months ago, but they're doing a great job - highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “A nice venue for hosting social functions”
Reviews.Author: Madame E
Reviews.Content: I really had the pleasure of visiting the newly opened Four Seasons for a social event in Baltimore. Our function was held at one of the event rooms on the second floor. The event room was spacious with a dance floor and two little side rooms. One of which had a piano and the other one was designated for the open bar. The staff were courteous and attentive. The food served as tasty and the bar tenders were very accommodating with our drink demands. In addition, the layout of the ladies bathroom is accessorized with big long mirrors, vanities, and comfortable resting sofas. I particularly liked the neatly rolled up hand towels, which add a little something extra to your experience. Though I can comment on the hotel rooms, its event rooms are definitely equipped to throw some fun parties. Besides, the Four Seasons is located in Harbor East, one of the most prime location in Baltimore. You can't go wrong with that.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful addition to Baltimore”
Reviews.Author: anm123
Reviews.Content: Went for a quick weekend getaway, and the hotel did not disappoint. The hotel decor is lovely, and the guest rooms are well thought out and nicely appointed. Service was amazing - remembering our names throughout our brief stay. Definitely look forward to going back again and staying longer! (If you want a great restaurant very close to the hotel, I highly recommend Charleston - a truly wonderful dining experience)

Reviews.Title: “Great new property - Right on Inner Harbor”
Reviews.Author: SarasotaTrav
Reviews.Content: Just took a dozen clients to the new Four Seasons Baltimore. Great location, nice rooms, really a great value for the rate. Excellent lobby bar - Wit and Wisdom - try the Picket Fence drink. Spring for the executive suites on an upper floor - great view and very nice lay out. Latest in techology. Staff remembered our names from day one!! Another great addition to the Four Seasons group.

Reviews.Title: “Great Getaway and Welcoming Staff”
Reviews.Author: JGNA11
Reviews.Content: Located in the new Harbor East section of Baltimore's Downtown, the Hotel offers access to the best Baltimore has to offer, within walking distance. The staff was courteous and professional, but not overbearing. We even were provided a private tour of the spa area and outdoor deck areas, after hours, when a staff member saw us exploring in the Hotel. The view of the Harbor and skyline really impressed. The restaurants of Little Italy beckoned from blocks away and the sites of historic Fell's Point and Canton are close, too. Also, be sure to visit the Baltimore Civil War Museum, located in what remains of the famed President's Street Railroad Station, notorious for the bloodshed in the streets when the movement of Union Troops through Baltimore from Presidents Street Station to the Camden Street Station sparked a riot pitting Southern sympathizers against Union supporters and the federal troops. The museum is a just a block or two from the Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!”
Reviews.Author: Justin F
Reviews.Content: A wonderful experience. I have already booked a second stay at this hotel just because of the great experience i had even though there are other hotels closer to my conference.

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon/Spa Getaway”
Reviews.Author: Brooker_335
Reviews.Content: The Four Seasons was the only hotel in Baltimore that had an in-house spa, so we booked for 2 nights. It was amazing. Strawberries and champagne delivered to our room both nights. The heat experience and spa was relaxing and wonderful, although gender separated, so don't plan on hanging with your partner if they are of the opposite sex. Wit and Widsom, the restaurant, had great food and amazing happy hour specials on food and drink, with a focus on "local." The bed was extremely comfortable, and my husband loved the bathroom tv in the mirror. From bellman to check-out, including the cleaning person, there was personal recognition of our celebratory event. Just perfect for the pampering we desired. Cost was as expected, and location at Inner Harbor and Fells Point is great. Self-parking garage available on site for less than valet, but without in-out privileges.

Reviews.Title: “Not yet The four seasons we know and love.”
Reviews.Author: whistleblower1
Reviews.Content: Most of what you would expect from the four seasons; however room service is not as professional or exceptional nor is the dining. It's the little things that the four seasons are not supposed to miss that are being overlooked. I have stayed there a few times and each time room service either misses something or does not get it right. For example we asked for something specific instead of bringing that item they brought something else totally unrelated without calling to ask if that would satisfy our needs. In the bar area we sat with empty drinks for quite a while. When we asked for the help of a waitress she told us " she was cut" and that we should ask someone else. The location is excellent, rooms are excellent, housekeeping is great staff is generally helpful but its not quit there yet.

Reviews.Title: “Not Your Typical Four Seasons Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Love2travel2carib
Reviews.Content: After staying at the Four Seasons Nevis (which was impeccable), we decided to stay in another Four Seasons to see if the stay would be just as enjoyable in the U.S. The hotel itself is beautiful but the staff attentiveness lacked. I was underwhelmed by the staff at arrival as well as at departure. The hotel seemed very crowded but not from guests of the hotel. This I felt, took away from the Four Seasons brand. The restaurant and lounge were overcrowded. The food was very good. The room was well appointed as it should be, considering it is a brand new hotel. Overall, a nice hotel but I feel it has not yet achieved the typical Four Seasons standard.

Reviews.Title: “Remarkable hotel and staff. Excellent addition to Baltimore's hotels!”
Reviews.Author: Devouex
Reviews.Content: The Four Seasons never disappoints and this hotel lives up to the reputation. Incredibly accommodating staff; always providing unparalleled service. Excellent location. Your next choice for group bookings.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in Baltimore and New Standard for Four Seasons”
Reviews.Author: DCJD2012
Reviews.Content: From the moment that you arrive at this property, you are given a warm welcome in the circle drive. The very nice young woman that checked me in was very kind and even walked me to the elevator as she re-confirmed my newspaper of choice. The lobby was calming and while convenient to bar and restaurant, you still have a nice distance from the craziness of after work happy hour. I love that the rooms do not open directly into the hallway. Each room is in an alcove and as soon as you enter the the room, you are welcomed with the warmth of the wood and layout of the room. Gone are the days of e traditional cookie cutter layout. The closet and bathroom are separated from the main room and each bathroom has a large bathroom with soaking tub, shower (including rain shower and traditional shower head,) separate wc for toilet and. Tv in the mirror with Bose sound. I ordered room service an cloves their unique menu and prompt service. All of the staff were incredibly friendly.they all deserve much credit for the warm welcome. If you're visiting Baltimore, or even live nearby, definitely treat yourself to a stay at the FS Baltimore.

Reviews.Title: “A business trip that felt like vacation”
Reviews.Author: Marybeth58
Reviews.Content: This is a stunningly beautiful hotel in a wonderful location. I was there for a meeting and the service by the banquet and conference staff was excellent. My room was lovely with great amenities (except an iron) and the latest conveniences for the traveler with multiple mobile devices. The bar is very busy (I guess people in Baltimore get off at 4:30??) but if you can snag a sofa - it's a great, lively place for a drink. Service was excellent. The concierge arranged to have a rental car delivered to the hotel for me. Every request was answered with a smile and wonderful service. I hope I get to go back soon!

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in Baltimore”
Reviews.Author: BGosivetti
Reviews.Content: Brand new, beautiful, luxurious and the usual Four Seasons attentive service levels. Harbor East has really become a vibrant, modern locale with great restaurants, shopping etc. Much of downtown is a reasonable walk, though this is all a bit far from the football and baseball stadiums if that's what's bringing you to Baltimore. Minor complaints would be that the room TV system in my harborview suite was virtually incomprehensible, and 3 elevators is not enough for this hotel when it's busy - had a number of waits and slow "local" rides up and down. This is a dramatic step above other Baltimore hotels in luxury and service.

Reviews.Title: “This is a beautiful hotel: great location, gorgeous views, attentive staff, and a beautiful restaurant.”
Reviews.Author: Kristen B
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Four Seasons with my kids and we had a fantastic time. The staff called us by name the entire time we stayed there. The location is perfect for families: you can walk to the Inner Harbor easily or it is a short water or car taxi ride. I especially liked that I felt like I had a nice grownup hotel experience, and my kids were equally taken care of and happy. There is not an indoor pool, however, so if you are looking for that, stay elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Good weekend trip..not wowed though...”
Reviews.Author: LoveLuxuryHotels
Reviews.Content: Spent the weekend at the new Four Seasons in Baltimore for a last minute getaway. Let me share some of my observations: •Beautiful, modern structure- more like a Park Hyatt than a Four Seasons, but very tastefully done. The rooms are contemporary with clean lines, yet super luxe as expected from the FS. Toiletries are La Occitane and the bathrooms have cool features such as a little TV embedded in the mirror. •Interesting Hotel Policies- we booked a fairly reasonable rate as part of the hotel’s introductory rates, and got a romance package that included breakfast and 2 mimosas. The package was a no- brainer, as was just $20-30 more than the room by itself. We had booked the night prior, and there were certainly rooms open in each category. During check in, we were offered an upgrade to a suite or a premier harbor view room (we had booked the standard harbor view, which is a step up than the basic marina view). Here was my shock- there was a cost to upgrade. I cannot recall the last time a hotel at the FS level charged for upgrades, when there are obviously open rooms available.(We were upgraded several levels at FS Bali some years ago, and the price difference between those rooms was way more than the total cost of a room at FS Baltimore!!) However shocked I was, we did shell out a bit for the corner view as the host talked it up quite a bit. Very odd policy, might be more suited for a Marriott, but took me by surprise here. •Room views - so after my shock at the upgrade situation, we checked into our premier corner harbor view room. The room had floor to ceiling windows in place of any outward facing walls. As some other reviewers have commented, one whole wall faces a parking lot and the Marriott. There’s only a smaller wall that faced the actual harbor. If this was the premier room, I wonder what views the standard rooms have. On observing the hotel from the street, there are a host of rooms that looked to have excellent views, I wonder if they were all suites. •Excellent bar/restaurant/café- the Michael Mina tavern was outstanding. Fancy ‘tavern’ interiors- think a super luxurious Pottery Barn, with interesting details such as small fireplaces, fox fur pillows everywhere. We did not have dinner, but enjoyed the tavern menu- the burger was one of the best I have ever had. There is also a café next door, with a host of goodies- crab pies, amazing chai tea, beignets! It seemed like a hang out spot for the John Hopkins business school alums, and I see why- calming view and a killer cup of coffee makes for a good spot to get some work done. Also did room service for a late dinner and our package breakfast- good, but not excellent. •Prime location- I was blown away by the inner harbor and fells point neighborhoods. It was my first time visiting Baltimore, and it is fun! Everything is a 5-7 minute walk from the hotel, including the aquarium. We spent one evening bar-hopping thru Fells Point- great wine stores, Waterfront grille was very cool as well. •Service is not Four Seasons par- the very fact that one had to think about service at a FS, since it is usually something you take for granted as being outstanding, goes to show there is still work to be done. The staff was confused, over whelmed and just plain rude in some cases, especially over the phone. The punch line- worth the value at this point, once the hotel moves past the introductory rates, hopefully they also improve on some of the policies and service, as it still needs work to be a true Four Seasons property.

Reviews.Title: “Fab hotel - very chic”
Reviews.Author: rimavh
Reviews.Content: We booked 6 rooms at the Four Seasons Baltimore. 6 couples. None disappointed. A few of us had corner suites which were very nice indeed. The "regular" rooms were plenty nice. Spacious, well laid out and nicely luxorius. The doormen and checkin staff were great. Room service, not so much. The Wit and Wisdom bar was lovely - decorated in the West Elm/Westeria catalog style I love. The night bar staff were a little obnoxious though (we were there Saturday 25th Feb closing to closing and they seemed anxious to get out of there which was an unpleasant surprise given how friendly and helpful the staff was there earlier in the day. This hotel is beautiful, modern without being dark. In fact, it is wonderfully light with tons of natural light/windows. I don't think I would stay anywhere else. Crowd is eclectic, well to do and over all ambiance is very nice. We did a private happy-hour at Roys right down the block with was very good also. A definate must do again.

Reviews.Title: “Book this hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: berg3
Reviews.Content: I would rate this hotel four plus stars. This is the perfect destination hotel for DC folks (or others) looking for a get away close to the DC area. The hotel is sparkling, brand new, luxurious and wonderful. The only reason I have given it 4 stars instead of five is that the service is not yet quite up to the furnishings. First, the views from the rooms are spectacular (get a harbor view). The furnishings, artwork, public areas are very well done. The outdoor pools look trendy and fun (but not open in February!). The spa area is clean and restful with nice treatment rooms and a very good "hot relaxation area" with jacuzzis, steam (with those changing colored pinpoint liights in the ceiling), sauna and heated beds. The restaurant is trendy and the food is quite good (esp. the breakfast). The location of the hotel is perfect -- it's near the Inner Harbor but not on top of it and the water taxi stops right out front. The service is a bit quirky. There are lots of friendly people working at this hotel but they haven't gotten it completely right. For example, while at dinner, the heat in our room was turned off. Also, we were having trouble with the sound system/TV in our room and the person who said she would call back to tell us how to use it, never called. However, none of this is a big deal. The hotel is terrific -- book it!

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous rooms and views!”
Reviews.Author: popites
Reviews.Content: Room amenities were amazing! Gorgeous bathroom with a TV even in the mirror. Beautiful views. Secluded and private suite away from the noise of other rooms. The bed was a little firm, but the rest of the room and hotel made up for it. Staff was very friendly. Just be careful with the mini bar because you are charged as soon as you take something out!

Reviews.Title: “All-around excellence...”
Reviews.Author: JTsfromPA
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this location because we go to Baltimore every year for a Valentine's weekend get-away. We arrived on a very cold day and were greeted with warm smiles! This sparkly, new Four Seasons is in a great location - it is an easy walk to Inner Harbor, and little Italy is a stone's throw away. Our guest room was fantastic - very large, comfortable and clean with a lovely view of the harbor. The hotel layout is great...guest room doors do not open to the hallway - but into little alcoves off of the hallway - which creates quiet and enhances privacy. The spa is spotless, welcoming and peaceful. I would recommend that you arrive at the spa early (ladies, take a bathing suit) and enjoy the pre-treatment experience that is offered. If you are booking a massage, request Derrick, he was expierenced and gave a fabulous aromatherapy massage. We had our Sunday breakfast at the "Wit and Wisdom" on-site restaurant - it was delicious and the service was top-notch. For sure, utilize the valet parking during your stay. Highly recommend this location!

Reviews.Title: “Baltimore now has a first class hotel”
Reviews.Author: gumdoc45
Reviews.Content: The Four Seasons recently opened in downtown Baltimore and we decided to try it out for a short getaway weekend. We opted to self park in the parking garage just below the hotel and it is very well lit and finding a spot was not difficult. The cost is $23 per 24 hour period, however, be careful going in and out of the garage as you could pay $23 for just 6 hours of parking. The hotel is what you would expect of a Four Seasons, excellent service and a beautiful facility. The fitness area was fine for our needs and the spa did serve free coffee until 10:00am. We did not have a chance to try any of the spa services as there were 3 weddings going on over the weekend and they were completely booked. The spa receptionist did take our name and room number and assured us if there was a cancellation she would let us know immediately. No cancellations materilailized. The restaurant, bar area, and coffee shop are all connected and it seems to be a very active place. We did not have a chance to eat at the restaurant, but we will be dining there in about 3 weeks and I will write a review of that. We were upgraded to a room with a balcony and there are certainly wonderful views of Balitmore Harbor. The quality of the bed, carpeting, furnishings, and bathroom was absolutely up to the Four Seasons standard. All the staff we encountered were excellent and we will certainly return here again for a quick getaway weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Not yet deserving of the Four Seasons halo”
Reviews.Author: ChrisGAnnapolis
Reviews.Content: We arrived excited but left disappointed. Yes, it's a beautiful and new building. Yes, it's the best hotel in Baltimore (not difficult to achieve). And yes, eventually it will become a true Four Seasons hotel. But it's not there yet and needs some work. The basic problem is the staffing model. The hotel is overwhelmed by its success. It needs more people on duty and the staff needs to remember that while it's important to be friendly, it's also important to get the job done. Pretty much every staff person with whom we spoke said they were too busy. We agree. We stayed one night during a recent three-day weekend when the hotel was hosting two weddings, one for a prominent local businessman and the other a huge destination wedding. We were not part of weddings but felt their impact. Sunday room service breakfast took an hour to deliver. The spa needed two receptionists on duty when there was only one. The front desk could not check out guests in a timely manner because they were either on the phone (why?) or chatting with friends. And then there was the parking. When you charge $40 for overnight parking you had better deliver good service. When we checked in on a Saturday afternoon we were assured that it would take only seven minutes to bring up our car, but you had to wonder because the place was already backed up and too many livery cars were allowed to idle in the small driveway. The next day, following the lousy and long checkout experience, our car was still not available even though we had called ahead. In the end it took more than 30 minutes to get the car to us and even then we had to load our luggage from the cart to the car because the staff, while numerous, was enjoying the view more than getting their job done. Was it the end of the world? No, but it also was not what one expects for $40 or from a Four Seasons. It wasn't all bad and the hotel deserves credit for trying hard. In our case, they delivered champagne and strawberries to us with an anniversary card even though it wasn't our anniversary -- but we appreciated the thought. The front desk offered a suite for a small upcharge but when told we preferred a good view over a bigger room, they kept us in our original room and passed on the additional revenue that a dishonest answer would have elicited. The bell staff, while harried, was terrific. The rooms are, indeed, beautiful. And the front desk clerk removed our breakfast charge after noticing my frustration with the checkout process and without even being asked. She also promised manager follow-up, which was nice. Will we be back? Of course we will. It's a beautiful escape destination in a neighborhood with some of the best restaurants in the DC/Baltimore region and a vibrant modern urban scene. We hear the hotel bar is excellent and look forward to sitting on the pool deck in better weather. We just hope the hotel learns how to match its staffing to its occupancy and to make certain that private events, however profitable, don't ruin the experience for the rest of us.

Reviews.Title: “By far the best hotel in Baltimore!”
Reviews.Author: Ray-bech
Reviews.Content: TOP staff, design, comfort, room. I rate 10/10 It's a brand new hotel, opened in Nov 2011.

Reviews.Title: “Newest member of the Four Seasons Family”
Reviews.Author: bankruptcy
Reviews.Content: This is a stunning building - all glass with exceptional views of the West Innner Harbour. Suites are huge with beautiful wood and furnishings throughout and 2 bathrooms and a dressing area. Reception and Concierge knock themselves out to please! Staff cannot do enough for guests. Food is very good especially from Room Service. Hotel opened in October and staff has to get acclimated since there were some problems. When "comped" items were delivered, server carried galsses with her fingers inside and dishes against her jacket to quickly complete service. There were also some housekeeping problems with the room but minor. Time will work them out. Recommend highly although I cannot imagine how they will cool the all glass tower in Baltimore's mid- Summer heat and humidity. A special nod to the Concierge Mirama who was exceptional..

Reviews.Title: “Where to stay in Baltimore”
Reviews.Author: Mike P
Reviews.Content: Had an excellent weekend in Baltimore and where we stayed was the chief contributor. The Fells Point location, the excellent staff, the airy bar and dining area, the view of the water, were all simply outstanding.It was everything we've come to expect from this excellent company. Entertainment, fine dining & nightlife were within a short walk. I grew up in Philadelphia and lived in Manhattan and I will say that I loved Fells Point. Great time.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Four Seasons”
Reviews.Author: willfchicago
Reviews.Content: Have stayed in a bunch of the newer US Four Seasons in the past couple of years and they have been a bit variable. Baltimore just opened and it feels like they are really on their game with this property. Staff were super friendly, rooms are great and views are fantastic Pros: Very tasteful high quality decor throughout Great friendly staff Very happening vibe in restaurant/bar/coffee shop areas Amazingly good spa Cons Little bit out of the way Felt a little understaffed

Reviews.Title: “Don't Miss this Fabulous Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Susan R
Reviews.Content: This hotel is one of the best in Baltimore. The staff is helpful and friendly, the lobby flowers are stunning, the views from the room and the fitness center were amazing. The rooms have floor to ceiling windows and overlook the marina/harbor and are a great size. You feel like you are in your own apartment instead of a hotel room. The bathrooms are wonderfully appointed and for once have space to put your belongings. Also, it was very quiet in the room even though you are walking distance to many shops and restaurants. The fitness center is on the top floor and overlooks the harbor. It has plenty of cardio equipment as well as free weights and the pool outside offers beautiful views. I will not stay any where else when I travel to Baltimore. The staff definitely makes you feel like they are excited to have you there and were able to check me in and get me settled all while I was on a conference call. It's nice to have a staff that understands that sometimes you can't get off the phone! I had previously reviewed this hotel and although my write-up was glowing I mistakenly gave it only a one circle/star rating (which was my bad). I am glad I was able to resubmit to make sure anyone who is going to Boston has a chance to experience this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The place to stay in Baltimore.”
Reviews.Author: Umanpaul
Reviews.Content: Here for a meeting. What a wonderful hotel. Great views of the harbor. Slick, comfortable rooms and a great Michael Mina restaurant and bar. Nice staff.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing and then some, I can't wait to stay again!”
Reviews.Author: Bob S
Reviews.Content: We had a fantastic experience at the hotel, we went for our anniversary. Service was top notch from the valet to the front desk. The managers were extremely kind and accomodating. It feels good to stay in a hotel where the staff seem genuinely happy to have you staying with them. The staff were coureous and had no trouble helping us feel right at home. The room was incredible, extremely spacious and clean. The views of the harbor were magnificent. I can't say enough about the staff, they really bring the hotel together, and make for a great stay. Remember it is a Four Seasons, so it is a little pricey, but totally worth it!

Reviews.Title: “Great and great views!”
Reviews.Author: alexandriava
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful stay at the hotel. The room was large and had everything you could want. Loved the tub. The ladies spa was very nice and not too crowded. It is expensive of course and adds up but would still return!

Reviews.Title: “Two Words to Describe this hotel-Magnificent, Magnificent!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: tarbash
Reviews.Content: Finally, Baltimore has been graced with a true, five star, luxury hotel. I have been to many five star hotels but this hotel truly shines!!! The hotel is wonderfully located near the Inner Harbor, Little Italy, downtown Baltimore and two major medical centers, University of Maryland and Johns Hopkins Hospital. When we drove up, we were immediately greeted by the doormen along with three other staff members before arriving at the front desk. The front desk staff was welcoming, kind and efficient. We were in awe of how beautiful the lobby and the entire hotel is. The art work is magnificent and the hotel is modern, clean, and advanced in technology. Our room had a magnificent view of the harbor and was equipped with a state of the art television and a T.V. even built into the glass of the bathroom wall. The rooms were modern and stylish and very roomy. The bed linens and bed itself made for hypnotic sleep and we enjoyed the wonderful bathroom and room amenities even having an nespresso maker in our room. The spa was an experience that I will always remember. The jacuzzi had lounges within them to ultimately relax, there were heated chairs, wonderful showers and steam and sauna rooms. The spa treatments were wide ranging and creatively magnificent. Being a foodie however I must say that besides the beautiful hotel and its amenities, Wit and Wisdom, the Michael Mina inspired restaurant is magnificent. The manager, Anthony Kinn, who we knew from his wonderful management of the Four Seasons Restaurant in Scottsdale, has done a magnificent job in making this restaurant a truly special dining experience. The restaurant has a wonderful "vibe" and its theme is to bring the flavors and foods from the region and prepare them in a spectacular manner using multiple open ovens that cause a permeation of the natural flavors throughout the restaurant. The music in the restaurant is well suited and the staff and service was amazing and efficient. I enjoyed lobster corndogs, clams, rib eye steak and delicious side dishes of brussel sprouts, potatoes and mushrooms. All very prepared carefully and with wonderful craft. The desserts were innovative. We had a maple nut pudding and a heavely rendition of a candy bar. The wine list was extensive and complete. My wife and I both agreed that whether for pleasure, to attend a conference, or to stay here if we needed to address medical concerns at one of the famous hospitals in Baltimore, this is the place to stay!!! We looked at the ballroom space and what is so unique is that it is on the second floor so the space has windows all around it to capture the beautiful water. We can't wait to re-visit this hotel again both to dine in but also to stay in!!!

Reviews.Title: “A great Experience”
Reviews.Author: Francoad
Reviews.Content: Beautiful property. Amazing Staff. The hotel is brand new and I experienced the spa and restaurant. I can truly say top notch off all hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Only the best”
Reviews.Author: Tim M
Reviews.Content: This hotel is simply the best I've experienced. Service is off the charts. From check-in to room service the staff was remarkable. Location to everything ti include inner harbor and little Italy. I will go back again and again.

Reviews.Title: “NEVER AGAIN !!!”
Reviews.Author: SpaChiq
Reviews.Content: This Baltimore location of Four Seasons, in my opinion is the MOTEL 6 of the Inner Harbor! We were booked for a multi day stay during Xmas. Checked in at Valet 54.00 per day plus in and out charge plus gratuity. Do not ask staff for directions. We ended up 45 minutes late for The Lion King after receiving bad directions from Four Seasons staff. Oh voy! Initial check in was not smooth as they were in the middle of a shift change! How Motel 6 of them!!! After waiting what seemed like forever we were told that our room was not yet ready! A flambouyant staffer offered us drinks at the bar until it was ready. A Bellman took our bags somewhere and off to the bar we went. The drinks were good but there was a HORRIBLE constant smell of burning ash that made me sneeze and nearly Vomit in the bar. I know, gross. Imagine how we felt!! About 20 minutes later we were offered apologies and escorted to our room. It was Totally unacceptable. We requested a corner room upon reservations, didn't get it. The stuffy room was soo small that it felt boxy with little ventilation. The a/c had a slight banging sound. The hallways in the room were very narrow and worst of all someone left a cigarette bud in the shower! The bathroom smelled of stale smoke. Is this the Four Seasons or Motel 6 ?! Additionally the mattress was uncomfortable and street noises could be heard. Also the curtains stop in the middle of the window thus blocking some of the view. Later that evening we were 45 minutes late for The Lion King after receiving bad directions from Four Seasons staff. Again, how Motel 6 of them. The only compliment I can offer this Under Experienced hotel is a view of the harbor. The next morning after our bad experiences with this possibly 1 star hotel, we CHECKED. OUT! And instead of offering us a courtesy discount Management confirmed that our card would be charged for all of the reserved days! Fine. Enjoy our money POOR SEASONS because my family, friends and.I will NEVER again stay at any POOR SEASONS hotel again

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, food and service!!!!”
Reviews.Author: mbagirl4
Reviews.Content: I was here for a Company Christmas Party. The staff was attentive and eager to serve. The rooms were top notch a little pricey but worth it.

Reviews.Title: “It's the Four Seasons!”
Reviews.Author: lawhoo97
Reviews.Content: Fantastic hotel - one of the most comfortable beds I have ever been in. The staff was very attentive and assisted us to the max. The room was spacious and comfortable and well designed. While we didn't have a "harbor view", we could still see the harbor and the city. Very nice. My one quibble is with the bar. While the staff was on top of things, the patrons left much to be desired. Simply because you are at the Four Seasons doesn't mean that you need to act like a pretentious twit. The next time, I'm going to walk down to the James Joyce Pub.

Reviews.Title: “Everything was perfect”
Reviews.Author: kwhitchurch
Reviews.Content: Went to a company holiday party here and stayed for one night. The hotel is new and right on the bay with lovely views. The room was beautiful and modern. Bed was comfortable. The dinner and party was perfectly executed and everyone had a lovely time. I would highly recommend the hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Nicest hotel in Baltimore -- and one of the best ever”
Reviews.Author: travelfangirl
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel with lovely rooms, beautiful public areas, lively bar and great location. It is simply fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Almost There..Devil in the Details!”
Reviews.Author: MGL1968
Reviews.Content: Beautiful facility throughout. Housekeeping needs more training, especially paying attention to small details in really delivering a truly clean guest-room. Also should stock the mini bar with more than a bag of chips. Variety and selection! Spa very nice, massage quality fair. Not the best therapists. Front door personnel also need to develop a little more flair..less casual small talk between themselves and more focus on service. If this hotel fine tunes itself, it can easily be the "go to" luxury hotel in the Mid-Atlantic.

Reviews.Title: “Brand New Four Seasons Baltimore”
Reviews.Author: NancFisher
Reviews.Content: Located on the Eastern side of Baltimore's Inner Harbor in a swanky area that once was a run-down section of Little Italy- one now has access to many great restaurants within walking of this brand new hotel! Opened about one month ago in November, I was pleasantly surprised with the elegance, modern relaxed atmosphere of this gorgeous hotel. The sleeping rooms look out over the city or out at the Baltimore Harbor. The staff is well trained as many are implants from other Four Seasons Hotels from across the country. There are a couple of "punch-list" items that need fixing in the spa but, overall, the place is incredible! We could not believe the popularity of the bar and restaurant in the evenings where one can find many well dressed/heeled people enjoying libations around a uniquely modern bar. The decor of dark hard wood floors, bubbly glass lamps and velvet couches and chairs adds a welcoming warm elegance to this locale. The sleeping rooms are of course five star comfortable, housekeeping impeccable and food delicious. The front desk staff is great and my only complaints were that the concierge (originally from Texas) needs to be trained on where the Meyerhoff Symphony Hall is located. We were given walking directions that sent us to their corporate headquarters, then had to take a cab as it was too far to walk. The restaurant service was a bit slow and inconsistent, but, I think this is due to the newness of the property. Otherwise, be aware that parking is $54.00 per night if you valet. Otherwise, my family and I had a wonderfully enjoyable time due to the personal pleasantness and courtesy of great service at this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great new hotel with the ultimate in comforts”
Reviews.Author: DeanJC
Reviews.Content: The Four Seasons is a brand new hotel in the new "Harbor East" district of downtown Baltimore. We stayed there for a Saturday night wedding and enjoyed walking around this new area as well as downtown. There are many new shops and restaurants here within easy walking distance. Little Italy is also a few blocks away. The hotel is what you would expect of a Four Seasons with plush, large rooms, flat screen TVs and great bedding. There was only 1 restaurant open at this time but another one is expected soon. One warning: valet parking is VERY expensive @ $54/day. There are plenty of garages nearby for less than $25/day. Had I known this, I would have parked elsewhere but the valet took the car before I could ask the price. I would definitely recommend this hotel if your business or pleasure takes you to Baltimore.

Reviews.Title: “We loved this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Reginacolon
Reviews.Content: We had an incredible view! Customer service was great. We will definitely return.

HotelInfo.Name: Four Seasons Baltimore
HotelInfo.Address: 200 International Drive, Baltimore, MD 21202
